definition: to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But he doesn't think the presence was something his subconscious conjured.
sentences.chinese: 但他不认为他的存在是一些别有用心的潜意识。

sentences.english: To set the film in an abattoir is itself devious.
sentences.chinese: 把故事安排在屠场，是别有用心的。

sentences.english: Relevant report is totally groundless and out of ulterior motives.
sentences.chinese: 有关报道毫无根据，是别有用心的。

sentences.english: Not to give a child a Chinese name is a simple act that speaks volumes.
sentences.chinese: 少为孩子取一个华文名，看似简单，其实，别有用心。

definition: harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to start rumours and create trouble
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
resolute person/person with aspirations/people who feel/people who use their heads
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to have sinister motives
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to have an axe to grind (idiom)
to harbor (evil) intentions/to be bent on/a tranquil heart or mind
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to have bad intentions
